thread.title: Clemson leads Notre Dame 14-3 at halftime
thread.title_full: Clemson leads Notre Dame 14-3 at halftime - Chicago Tribune

author: Paul Skrbina
title: Clemson leads Notre Dame 14-3 at halftime
text:
A meeting of top-12 teams in Death Valley was dominated by news of historic rainfall in South Carolina that prompted President Barack Obama to declare a federal state of emergency. Clemson took over dominating Notre Dame from there. The No. 12 Tigers scored on their first two drives and led the No. 6 Irish 14-3 at halftime.
On offense: Notre Dame back C.J. Prosise, who entered the game averaging 150 yards per, was held to 4 yards on 10 carries in the first half. Will Fuller entered with six touchdown catches, third in the country, but was held to one catch in the first half. Clemson quarterback Deshaun Watson, who was fourth in the nation in completion percentage (74.4), was 6-for-12 for 65 yards and a pair of TDs.
On defense: The Tigers came in ranked ninth in overall defense, and it showed in the first half. They held Notre Dame, which was putting up 531.2 per game, to 137 yards, including 41 on the ground. Coming in, the Irish had topped 200 yards rushing five games in a row, their most since 2000.
First-time starter: Marist graduate Nic Weishar, a tight end, made his first career start Saturday for Notre Dame.
Injury report: Notre Dame safety Avery Sebastian did not play because of a concussion. … Irish receiver Corey Robinson played after missing last week’s game with a knee injury.
